Allergy intolerance model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference

a.title: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.

tr.td:
A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.
Binding Description: (preferred): 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.24 eHDSIActiveIngredient (ATC, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.61 eHDSISubstance (EMA SMS, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.19 eHDSIAllergenNoDrug (SCT, used in MH@EU); ICD-11 Allergens

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

short.value: Allergy intolerance model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

short.value: Common header for all patient-related data

definition.value: Common header for all patient-related data
Patient/subject information

short.value: Business identifier for the object

definition.value: Business identifier for the object
Resource authoring details
Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

short.value: Date and time of authoring/issuing

definition.value: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

short.value: Date and time of the last update to the resource

definition.value: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

short.value: Status of the resource

definition.value: Status of the resource

short.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.

definition.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.
Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
Business version of the resource.

short.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

definition.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

definition.value: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL. Cardinality in MyHealth@EU for this element, used here, is one manifestation per severity and onset, while the cardinality in FHIR IPS IG allows multiple manifestations per severity and onset.

description.value: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.5 eHDSIIllnessandDisorder (ICD-10, alternative in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.11 eHDSIReactionAllergy (SCT, alternative in MH@EU); ICD-11 MMS

short.value: Date and time of allergy manifestation

definition.value: Date and time of allergy manifestation

short.value: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.

definition.value: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

description.value: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.13 eHDSISeverity (SCT, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/reaction-event-severity (HL7, Required in HL7 FHIR)

short.value: Date of the observation of the reaction

definition.value: Date of the observation of the reaction

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

short.value: Allergy intolerance model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

short.value: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.

definition.value: A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

description.value: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.24 **eHDSIActiveIngredient** (ATC, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.61 eHDSISubstance (EMA SMS, used in MH@EU); 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.19 eHDSIAllergenNoDrug (SCT, used in MH@EU); ICD-11 Allergens

short.value: This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)

definition.value: This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU

short.value: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance

definition.value: Textual description of the allergy or intolerance

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, ISO IPS

short.value: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

definition.value: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

description.value: 1.3.6.1.4.1.12559.11.10.1.3.1.42.57 eHDSICriticality (HL7, used in MH@EU); http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-criticality (HL7, required in HL7 FHIR)

definition.value: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

short.value: Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, etc.

definition.value: When allergy or intolerance was identified
